## Combined Inputs

Multiple inputs can work together. Here, a **select dropdown** filters countries while a **switch** toggles the benchmark.


```r
content <- create_content() %>%
  add_input_row(style = "inline", align = "center") %>%
    add_input(
      input_id = "country_filter",
      label = "Select Countries",
      filter_var = "country",
      options = countries_by_region,
      default_selected = c("United States", "Germany"),
      width = "450px"
    ) %>%
    add_input(
      input_id = "show_average",
      label = "Show Benchmark",
      type = "switch",
      filter_var = "country",
      toggle_series = "Global Average",
      override = TRUE,
      value = TRUE
    ) %>%
  end_input_row()
```

## Global Publication Trends

```{r timeline-pct-female-country-2}
# Global Publication Trends
result <- viz_timeline(
  data = data,
  title = "Global Publication Trends",
  time_var = "decade",
  y_var = "pct_female",
  group_var = "country",
  chart_type = "line",
  subtitle = "Compare countries against the global benchmark",
  x_label = "Decade",
  y_label = "% Female Authors",
  cross_tab_filter_vars = "country"
)

# Set chart height
if (inherits(result, 'highchart')) {
  result <- highcharter::hc_size(result, height = 500)
}

result <- dashboardr:::.embed_cross_tab(result)

# Force container height with explicit wrapper
result <- htmltools::div(
  style = 'height: 500px !important; min-height: 500px !important; width: 100%; overflow: visible;',
  result
)

result
```
